name: Osu!! Karate Bu
description:
Somewhere deep in the city of Osaka, there's a notorious sports club known for producing some of Osaka's most notorious (yet toughest) street thugs. Its name is the Karate Club, based on the grounds of Kangokou High School. But now the club's in danger of losing that reputation. A bunch of would-be tough guys have come to Osaka, and are out to prove themselves against the club. It's up to Yoshiyuki Takagi, the leader of the club and of the Osaka thug scene, to turn them back and prove, once and for all, that his club is truly the toughest of the tough.

Based on the Japanese manga series, Osu!! Karate Bu is a fighting game similar to those being produced at the time in which a single player controlling Yoshiyuki Takagi battles through a series of tough men in order to prove his club's toughness. Each of the game's 12 characters has a life meter that must be reduced to 0, as well as a chi meter which not only allows players to execute special moves (depending on how much chi is left), but also helps players get back up after getting knocked out. (The quicker you get up, the more health you gain back.) But this can only be done twice per match, and if it happens three times you'll be down for the count.

In addition to the story mode, players can also choose to play an arcade mode in which any character can prove he's the toughest, as well as a 2-player VS mode and a team battle in which players choose teams of up to five combatants to battle against each other.

shot.caption: Title screen.
Part of the intro (before the title screen).
Introducing the characters. Yoshiyuki Takagi.
Let's play the Story mode. The first opponent is... Makoto And?, one of Osaka's five most powerful gang leaders.
Don't worry, Takagi is not a paedophile. The "little girl" is Momochiyo Honda.
Uhm? What's going on babe...?
Ok... one more worthless animal to be defeated. That's J?jir? Sakuma.
Sakuma, I think you should change your hairstyle?
Versus Zen Suenaga. Diggin' the scenario.
Against two weirdos. No worries, I can handle them.
Very close to be defeated.
Hajime! "In the Japanese traditional martial arts such as karate, judo, aikido and kendo, it is a verbal command to "begin"."
Against Rick Powered.
Huh yeah, it was tough.
"Mysterious" creature.
After some story (one more cutscene or so)... What the hell do you want?
Everyone is so badass.
Against Tetsuya Sotogawa.
So what's going on? I dont feel like telling you the story...
You again? Yeah, we actually didn't fight before.
Dizzy (baby chicken). Gotta reveal his name: Kira Takashi, my childhood friend. If you want to read more about the story (and also the baby chicken thingy), just go to Wikipedia or so.
What? Why can't I execute such trick?
Nevermind... Eat this bro!
Who's the "Soul of Osaka", huh?
More story/cutscenes.
Introducing a "stage".
Off to... somewhere.
Osaka map.
"Master"?
Ah... love hurts.
Cry more. Lubricate your eyes.
"Continue?" screen. Funny, I "lost the game" while doing a sh*tty training with tree trunks... :)
Teaching me a new "trick"?
Hell yeah. You have to execute it five times. If you fail... the character will not "learn" it.
Deathblow! Hah... poor old man...
Vega's (or Balrog's) relative? Nah, not really...
Good kick. Stylish movement. Well done. After defeating this piece of sh*t, there's an obese piece of sh*t to be defeated.
The obese dude was very weak... Now... The final battle...
Can't execute the supreme trick. No enough energy.
Victorious.
Toughness...
After more cutscenes and game credits... The End.
Arcade mode. Battle introduction.
Bear hug...! All the characters have their "special trick".
Finished the Arcade mode using the character Rick Powered.
Characters. These two (Super Takagi and Momochiyo) are secret, they will appear only if you use a code.
She loves crying... that's her speciality...
Nice skull.
I would love to show all these beauties, but enough is enough.
Ok, just one more. Tsunami-style?
